title: Understanding SQL Ordering
text: In SQL, the ORDER BY clause is used to sort the result set of a query by one or more columns. By default, it sorts in ascending order.

title: Descending Order
text: To sort the results in descending order, you need to use the DESC keyword after the column name in the ORDER BY clause.

title: Applying ORDER BY Clause
text: What SQL clause would you use to sort the 'Price' column from highest to lowest?
